data.title: Decent Food, challenging service
data.text:
We ate dinner & breakfast here during our stay.  Service on both was less than stellar. At breakfast it was clear the staff were overwhelmed; it took about 10 mins to get seated. 
We had vouchers towards breakfast which the server promised to apply towards our bill, which didn't happen. Despite a follow up call to ask about this, so far no response.

data.title: Quiet diner in Hotel Restaurant
data.text: Restaurant is attached to the bar, so it could get a bit noisy. Very limited menu, however what I had was very good. Good, attentive wait staff.

data.title: Nice hotel restaurant
data.text: This was a nice hotel restaurant with a limited menu. My group ordered a number of items that looked and tasted good. Food options were a little pricey. Had the bbq pork flatbread, which was sweet and spicey. The Jupiter lemonade was delicious!

data.title: Quiet Breakfast place
data.text: Good for business meetings and place is generally not crowded only hotel guests show up. Evening the bar scene is quiet as well, so great place for biz drinks

data.title: Not much to choose from
data.text: Had a long stay in the hotel and to my surprise there were just few meals and hardly anything for vegetarian. Food is average. Considering its the only restaurant in the hotel, they should seriously think of increasing options. Saving grace is nearby restaurants.

data.title: Convenient, easy and delicious neighborhood restaurant
data.text: We are regular customers visiting at least twice a month. Conveniently located, easy parking, near by Apple and Seagate. Casual atmosphere and quick turnaround. May not be the place for special occasions but it    serves decent Italian dishes for day to day requirements. Note That Waiting service is not 5 stars. They are there just to do their jobs.

data.title: Overpriced and Limited Menu
data.text: This small place offers tasty food in an average setting by friendly staff.  That's all fine until you get the bill... Way overpriced.  There are tons of places nearby with better food and more creative cooking.  Avoid this restaurant unless you have corporate expense dollars to burn!

data.title: Tasty mushroom soup!
data.text:
Nice place with a bar and dark wood interior. One of the perfect corp. business and business lunch restaurants. 

The order got mixed up, and we got the wrong soup, but when we finally got our mushroom soup it was devine! I wanted more! 4stars****. 

The greens in the baby mixed greens were not the freshest, and sort of tasted a little "raw" but all the other ingredients were great. 2stars**.

data.title: Very slow and unprofessional service for breakfast
data.text:
Very slow and unprofessional service for breakfast. Good luck if you have our server Madison. She was the worse server I have seen this year. 

-Took a long time for her to take our order, The "I'll be right with you" took 10 minutes although there were only a few tables she was serving 

-I asked for water for our table and got one glass to share for 2 people

-My dad asked for butter and cream cheese with his bagel and only got cream cheese. 

-We waited over 35 minutes for a simple French Toast and continental breakfast when the restaurant is not busy. I suspect Madison intentionally delayed our order that day because 1) the table next to us placed the order after us got their breakfast at least 10 minutes before we did and the gentleman also ordered French Toast. Unless it takes 35 minutes to toast a bagel for the continental breakfast, the server probably did something to delay our order 2) I ordered the same breakfast items in the past week and the kitchen never took that long to fulfill the order. 

-The server went MIA after we got our food, so it was a long wait to get our check and then another long wait for her to pick up my credit card.

-I was again incorrectly billed when I got the check despite talking to Madison about the exact same error the day prior. And then had to talk to the restaurant manager who was equally confused about the breakfast benefit for Hilton Gold. It's been months since Cypress became Hilton Juniper, why are the servers and the manager still confused?

There goes our morning, not a pleasant way to start the day. 

You want to know how terrible the breakfast service was? After enduring Madison for 2 consecutive days, my family and I cancelled the remaining 2 weeks of our stay at the Juniper Hotel and booked the Aloft Cupertino down the road just to avoid this restaurant for breakfast.

data.title: Better than average burger
data.text: I had a quick and basic early afternoon burger that I would rate as better than average.  Service was good even at a time of day when only wait staff on duty.

data.title: Happy Hour and bomb food!
data.text: The cocktails here are actually pretty legit for a small hotel. The selection of bitters and ingredients is vast. The food is really good, the mussels with sausage and garlic was divine. The little pork tacos was also very tasty, if you don't want to venture out in Cupertino, just eat here in pajamas. You won't regret it.

data.title: Nice Luncheon Stop
data.text: The place is perfect for and Saturday or Sunday brunch.  Prices are very good, parking is easy food is excellent.  The place is located in a hotel that recently changed ownership.

data.title: Great Hotel Restaurant
data.text: Recently had a special birthday lunch for eight at this restaurant.  The quality of the food, service, and presentation were all excellent.  Portions were large, with good value for the price.  Kenny, the manager, and Haike, the server, all did their best to make our celebration a wonderful experience.  This restaurant is located in The Juniper Hotel, which is part of the Hilton Hotels chain.  Keep up the good work!

data.title: Friendly restaurant in a hotel
data.text:
The restaurant is attached to the Juniper Hotel. The restaurant staff are friendly and helpful. The refilling is frequent and no need to ask for. 

The food quality is good.

data.title: Average hotel restaurant
data.text: I came in, lured by the previous positive reviews found here on Tripadvisor, expecting something above average. I'm afraid to report that the reviews are to be taken with grain of salt (literally). Had some of the saltiest eggs Benedict for breakfast, followed by the Mt. Salt New York strip steak for dinner. I ordered medium-rare and got something close to well-done-to-overcooked-gray with spinach leaves drown in powder red paprika. But the service was friendly and beer suggestions were spot on. Three review-points just for that bit of service, this venue really needs to work on the quality though.

data.title: Nice place to visit, even if you don't live here.
data.text:
My wife and I head to the Park Place restaurant on special occasions.  That's because there are many other restaurants in the area that offer far better value for food, but the Park Place is fairly special, serving seasonal food that is well prepared.  

We find the servers to be great, the drinks on the expensive side (most likely because the place caters to traveling business people on expense accounts) but the atmosphere is great and the food is always good. 

Definitely worth a try if you live in the area, and if you are visiting you'll be pleased that there is a good restaurant located in the hotel.

data.title: Great Restaurant for Hotel
data.text:
This is a cozy and great restaurant inside the new Juniper hotel which is one of the newest Curio collection of Hilton Hotels ... It was the Cypress hotel owned by Kimpton for many years. 
The atmosphere was very nice and the food was prepared perfectly. It has a great outside patio for when the weather is nice and that's almost always :)

data.title: DUCK NACHOS...Yes please! Small menus, but good food, nice atmosphere!
data.text: Found this little place and enjoyed the open patio. Even though it's on a busy street noise was minimal. Wine and food menu a little small, but easy to find something tasty on both. Relaxed and service was good.

data.title: Excellent NY steak special
data.text: Wow we love the steak specials. If they have this at dinner, get it!! I usually call to see what the dinner special is and if they have it we're definitely going. The bread they serve with herb butter is quite tasty and good starter to a delectable meal.

data.title: Okay Restaurant
data.text: The service was okay, but apparently the cook did not know how to prepare eggs.  I ordered "medium" cooked eggs.  Hard cooked!  A couple of the people in our party ordered eggs benedict.  Again, eggs were hard cooked and very little sauce.  Toast was cold.  Had to ask for butter and by the time we got the butter, toast was even colder.
